etymology.description: 民(people) + 主(master; primary) = people as masters (democracy).
etymology.interpretation: Emphasizes political authority vested in the people; a calque for 'rule by the people'. Contrasts with 君主 ('monarch'), shifting mastery from ruler to the populace.

examples.chinese: 我们珍惜民主和自由(我們珍惜民主和自由)。
这个国家通过选举实现民主(這個國家通過選舉實現民主)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège guójiā tōngguò xuǎnjǔ shíxiàn mínzhǔ.
examples.english: This country achieves democracy through elections.

examples.chinese: 民主制度需要公民参与与监督(民主制度需要公民參與與監督)。
examples.pinyin: Mínzhǔ zhìdù xūyào gōngmín cānyù yǔ jiāndū.
examples.english: Democratic institutions require citizen participation and oversight.
